intro: Malpighia malifolia, commonly known as the Mexican elderberry or white elderberry, is a small evergreen shrub native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Malpighiaceae family and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are usually ovate to elliptic in shape. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by bright red, fleshy berries that are edible for humans and birds. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies and traditional medicine.
